text: Orion Corporation (), founded in 1917 and headquartered at Espoo, Finland, is a Finnish company, which develops, manufactures and markets pharmaceuticals, active pharmaceutical ingredients and diagnostic tests for global markets. The company also has a large R&D; unit in Turku. Orion's class A and B shares are listed on the Helsinki Stock Exchange. ==Products== {| | *Antiparkinson agents :* Comtan/Comtess (entacapone) :* Stalevo (entacapone, carbidopa, levodopa) :* Eldepryl (selegiline) *Animal surgical anesthetics and analgesics :* Dexdomitor (dexmedetomidine) :* Domitor (medetomidine) :* Domosedan (detomidine) :* Antisedan (atipamezole) *Antiandrogens :* Nubeqa (darolutamide) * Analgesics :* Indalgin (indometacin, ethylmorphine) :* Dexdor (dexmedetomidine) :* Para-Tabs (paracetamol) :* Generic drug of pregabalin * NSAIDs :* Burana (ibuprofen) :* Ketorin (ketoprofen) :* Pronaxen (naproxen) * Anti-diabetic drugs :* Glimepirid Orion (glimepiride) :* Metforem (metformin) :* Origlucon (glibenclamide) * Gastric acid related drugs :* Ranimex (ranitidine) :* Zolt (lansoprazole) * Oral hygiene :* Daktarin (miconazole) :* Elmex (olaflur) * Motion sickness drugs :* Vertipam (cyclizine, diazepam and nicotinic acid) * Vitamins :* Cohemin (cyanocobalamin) :* Neuramin (thiamine) * Anticoagulants :* Marevan (warfarin) * Cardiovascular drugs :* Digoxin (digoxin) :* Disomet (disopyramide) :* Dopmin (dopamine) :* Kiniduron (quinidine) :* Lidocard (lidocaine) :* Nitro (glyceryl trinitrate) :* Nitrosid (isosorbide dinitrate) :* Ormox (isosorbide mononitrate) * Antihypertensive drugs :* Amlodipin Orion (amlodipine) :* Carvedilol Orion Pharma (carvedilol) :* Dilzem (diltiazem) :* Escor (nilvadipine) :* Espesil (acebutolol) :* Lisipril (lisinopril) :* Lopril (captopril) :* Nifangin (nifedipine) :* Orloc (bisoprolol) :* Pinloc (pindolol) :* Pratsiol (prazosin) :* Propral (propranolol) :* Selopral (metoprolol) :* Verpamil (verapamil) :* Lisipril Comp (lisinopril and hydrochlorothiazide) :* Orloc Comp (bisoprolol and hydrochlorothiazide) *Inotropic drugs :* Simdax (levosimendan) * Diuretics :* Diurex (hydrochlorothiazide and amiloride) :* Furesis (furosemide) :* Furesis Comp (furosemide and triamterene) :* Hydrex (hydrochlorothiazide) :*
